Frequently Asked Questions

Why is my data at risk now?

Quantum computing is a rapidly developing field, and these computing devices have the power to break your encryption relatively easily. For example, AES 128, Elliptic Curve Cryptography, and Digital Signature Algorithms (DSA), which is commonly used even in most government contracts, are all at risk now. Algorithms that took 120 years to break have ended up becoming susceptible to unauthorized decryption within minutes or hours, thanks to Quantum Computing.

What are quantum computers anyway?

A quantum computer is a type of computer that performs calculations and operations using principles of Quantum Mechanics, as opposed to traditional computers. Unlike the tradtional computers that use bits (0 and 1), they use Qubits or Quantum Bits. Qubits can have multiple values at the same time, a principle commonly postulated in Quantum Mechanics. As a result, they facilitate parallel processing, thereby lowering the time for simultaneous operations. They are also interconnected with each other via Entanglement, making the integration of bottom-up complex calculations a lot faster.

What is quantum-resistant cryptography?

It is a set of cryptographic algorithms designed to remain secure against attacks from quantum computers.

What makes QuantumSure better than the password vault I already use?

QuantumSure is one of the only password vault services that is Quantum secure. It is also one of the most compliant, providing you with an entire password sharing audit trail, in case required to monitor password sharing and access.

Let's take a look at how it compares to others:

Feature QuantumSure Your Password Vault
Post Quantum Encryption Yes No
Zero-Trust Sharing Yes No
Group Sharing Yes (one click) No
Group Revocation Yes No
Stores Your Master Key on Server No Yes
Audit Trail Yes No
Transparent Algorithm Yes (Kyber) No

How does QuantumSure protect my data?

QuantumSure uses NIST-approved post-quantum algorithms and real-time monitoring to ensure robust security. Taking the threat of Quantum Computing very seriously, QuantumSure uses multilayered algorithms, integrating Fernet-like cryptography, Kyber 1024, and decoy keys to ensure that the client data is ready to stand to the test of hacking and malicious actors in a post-quantum world.

Can I integrate QuantumSafe with my existing systems?

Yes, our SaaS platform is designed for seamless integration. Check our documentation for details.

Do I need to share my sensitive data for this?

NO. QuantumSure works by doubly encrypting your passwords, first on your end, and then on our end. The Master Password you use while creating your account isn't stored by QuantumSure, meaning not even we can access your confidential data.

Can I use already encrypted data instead?

Yes! If you want to add an extra layer of security, you can store passwords after encrypting them with your own algorithms, and then storing them. QuantumSure is data-neutral, so it will store anything you want as a 'password'. Please remember that you need to decrypt in a similar manner on your end if you opt to do this.

I forgot my Master Password. What can I do?

QuantumSure does NOT store your Master Password and CANNOT access the decrypted passwords. Consequently, it mean that we cannot recover your Master Password for you if you lose it. Hence, please be sure to NEVER misplace or forget it.

What is the pricing like?

QuantumSure has different tiers. For small teams and individuals, it is $5.99 a month for a 1000 encrypt requests (decryption is free). For medium-sized companies, it is $12.99 for 15000 encrypt requests a month. For entreprise level clients, it is $49.99 for 100000 encrypt request a month. Please reach out to our team for signing up for these or a custom tier.
